title: NextLevelSystems
author: NextLevelSystems
content: Dear Citizens,Selling my own project (Which I wanted to run, but of lack of staff and investors it's failed.)Packet includes - - Domain name- Design with logos, banners, and promos.- Full source code- VDS ServerFunctionality:** All games usses provably fair (still you can twist settings to maximize profits) Sports-Betting module included,Games - Keno, Mines, Plinko, Roullete, Stairs, Blackjack, Dice, Limbo and etc.** Also can include exclusive crash game with Dinosaurs.- Coinbase Ecommerce, Infura Io, and original node based payments.- Admin paneland many other options like promocodes, race contest and such on.Price : 3350$  entire project. Possibile to negotiate with real buyer.Only people who interested are welcomed, no kids and scammers.- Telegram: @AxesSebastian Email: NextLevelSystems@tutanota.com

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: I think it is not lack of staff and investors that made your project collapsed. It is lack of money that made the project to be a failed project. I will advise you to look for cash and start the project, because that will fetch you more money than selling it but if you are interested to sell the fantastic project, it is well, it is your choice.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Quite off topic but I think it would be hard to sell an existing cryptogambling site or even structured already. Investors would prefer starting it from the roots in such way, the project would be more efficient and they will already see problems before the actual release than them troubleshooting afterwards when they bought a finished platform. But it would be worth trying to sell especially since Op have mentioned problems or cause of its cancellation. With that, I suggest putting or attachment of the platform itself or its concept which would give possible investors or buyers the idea already. In most instances, they'd be too lazy to check it one by one.

comments.author: NextLevelSystems
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on March 31, 2023, 08:40:58 PMI think it is not lack of staff and investors that made your project collapsed. It is lack of money that made the project to be a failed project. I will advise you to look for cash and start the project, because that will fetch you more money than selling it but if you are interested to sell the fantastic project, it is well, it is your choice. You absolutely right. Thanks for correcting me. I'm selling it because I was enthuasiast as many there ..  but to run casino bussiness you need to have a big bankroll for the start and finding a investors it's not a easy work. Resources are the most important part of this bussines which I lack entirely. That's very sad from either to drop it from hands, but maybe someone who has team already or willing to try venture on his own will be interested..Appreciate for kind words dude, things hurts..Regards

comments.author: NextLevelSystems
comments.body: Quote from: Yatsan on March 31, 2023, 10:08:05 PMQuite off topic but I think it would be hard to sell an existing cryptogambling site or even structured already. Investors would prefer starting it from the roots in such way, the project would be more efficient and they will already see problems before the actual release than them troubleshooting afterwards when they bought a finished platform. But it would be worth trying to sell especially since Op have mentioned problems or cause of its cancellation. With that, I suggest putting or attachment of the platform itself or its concept which would give possible investors or buyers the idea already. In most instances, they'd be too lazy to check it one by one.Hey! Thanks for the reply. Website can be fully redesigned. And also there is link to site in my telegram description. Ofcourse it easier for beginning just offered all I have because I will anyways throw it away and will lay unusabale so potential buyer may take and have it as a gift for the project... well the system ir self has no "major" issues, the issue is like connecting slots over api - requires money.. trying to run some giveaways - requires money. Some better unicum design - requires money. I ran it alone, spent about 15,000$ on everything, searched for people to join, but was unsuccessfull, not because site is bad, just that it's hard to get trust from people you never met.. We live in world full of fraud, and because of the people doing type of this things loyal people who actually looking for real help suffer at most...Regards
